page.title: 06ROYAL COMMISSION INVENTORIES
page.content: { West Knighton:}Lewell Mill is a 16th century building with rubble walls. It was originally the mill itself and the millers house but has since been modified. {Woodsford:}Woodsford Castle is undoubtedly the most significant building in the area.The RCHM inventory describes it as "a rare and remarkable example of a small strong fortified house of the mid-14th century".It originally had square towers at each corner and one in the middle if the East side,but only that at the North-East corner still survives. The walls originally had over hanging parapets,but the upper parts of the walls and the roof were rebuilt,probably in the latter part of the 17th century.
